definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: Give up our tea break? No way!
sentences.chinese: 让我们放弃工作休息时间？没门儿。

sentences.english: A monopoly means no way in, no second player.
sentences.chinese: 垄断的意思是没门儿进来，没有第二个竞争者。

sentences.english: Can you lend me money? No way.
sentences.chinese: 可以乞贷给我吗？没门儿。

definition: in your dreams!/as if!/You wish!/I wish that were so
my old mother/I, this old woman/my old lady (colloquial)/maternal grandmother/midwife
see 王八羔子[wang2 ba1 gao1 zi5]
contraction of 不用[bu4 yong4]/need not/please don't
to refuse a toast only to be forced to drink a forfeit/fig. to hesitate to do sth until forced to do even more
pinyin: jing4 jiu3 bu4 chi1 chi1 fa2 jiu3

definition: to pester someone again and again
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
lit. even harder than reaching the sky (idiom)/fig. extremely difficult/far from an easy task
